benchmark_details.name: U-MATH (University Math)
benchmark_details.overview: U-MATH is a novel benchmark for evaluating mathematical skills in LLMs, consisting of 1,100 unpublished university-level problems sourced from teaching materials, covering six core subjects with 20% multimodal problems.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of LLMsâ€™ mathematical capabilities and address gaps present in existing benchmarks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: U-MATH does not cover the full range of advanced topics and may introduce biases by favoring certain problem types.

data.source: Sourced from teaching materials at top US universities.
data.annotation: Problems curated and validated by subject matter experts.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the LLM's evaluation of free-form answers against the provided solutions.
methodology.interpretation: High performance indicates better reasoning abilities in tasks; model accuracy varies across problem types.
methodology.validation: Validated by subject matter experts to ensure appropriateness for university-level assessment.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data is collected with appropriate permissions; no personal or proprietary information is included.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Open-sourced under a permissive license to facilitate research.
